questions.question: Tell us the differences between uncontrolled and controlled components.
questions.answer: Uncontrolled components are those where the form data is handled by the DOM itself, while controlled components are those where the form data is handled by the React component state.

questions.question: How to validate React props using PropTypes
questions.answer: You can validate React props using PropTypes by defining the expected data types and any additional validation rules for the props of a component using the PropTypes library.

questions.question: Tell us the difference between nodejs and express js.
questions.answer: Node.js is a runtime environment for executing JavaScript code outside the browser, while Express.js is a web framework for Node.js that simplifies the development of web applications using Node.js by providing additional features and tools.

questions.question: What is a custom hook, and why will you create a custom hook?
questions.answer: A custom hook is a reusable piece of logic that can be shared between multiple components in a React application. You can create a custom hook when you find yourself writing the same code in multiple components, or when you need to extract complex logic from a component to make it more reusable and easier to test.
